channel.title: OTB Rugby on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics
channel.description: Recent content in OTB Rugby on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics

item.title: Rugby Daily | Doris Day as back rower signs contract, Snyman salary revealed, Quinlan on Munster woes | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Monday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news of a new deal for Caelan Doris. The incredible sum being allegedly offered to RG Snyman by Leinster has been revealed, and we hear from Leo Cullen on the prospective deal. There's reaction following a mixed weekend for Irish provinces in the Investec Champions Cup, with Alan Quinlan giving his view on where things have gone wrong for Munster so far.

item.title: Rugby Daily | Cullen on Snyman, Leinster prop to France, Lee retires | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack has team news from all four provinces - and their opponents - ahead of a bumper week of Investec Champions Cup action. Leo Cullen has given his side of events regarding RG Snyman's potential move to Leinster. Samson Lee's been forced to quit rugby. And another experienced international is off to France. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily: Farrell signs new Ireland deal, IRFU reach gender balance target, Jones on Japan return | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Thursday's Rugby Daily, Cathal Mullaney brings you news of Andy Farrell's contract extension with the IRFU. The IRFU has also achieved its gender balance target on its Union Committee. Eddie Jones has been speaking about his return as Japan's head coach. Keith Wood has his say on Ulster's recent struggles. And a Welsh player has been forced to retire due to injury. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Eddie Jones back to Japan, Vunipola cleared, O'Mahony won't be risked | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Wednesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news of the appointment of a new Japan head coach. And you'll NEVER guess who it is.... alright, you probably know. Billy Vunipola is cleared to play for Saracens against Connacht this weekend. And Munster say they won't take any risks regarding Peter O'Mahony's fitness. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Henshaw on Sale, Ulster's Moxham blow, Schmidt for Wallabies job? | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Tuesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack has injury news from Ulster, Leinster and Munster ahead of this weekend's fixtures in the Investec Champions Cup. We hear from Robbie Henshaw and attack coach Andrew Goodman, who look ahead to Leinster's meeting with Sale - a game you can hear live and exclusive on Saturday's Off The Ball. A new Rugby Australia appointment could lead to Joe Schmidt getting the Wallabies job.

item.title: The Red 78 Unlocked: Below par Munster struggle against Bayonne, and Exeter Chiefs test on the horizon - Ep.80 | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Ruairi O’Hagan is joined by Munster legends Alan Quinlan and Fiona Hayes to look back on a poor performance against Bayonne in the Champions Cup. Fiona and Alan pick their Star of the Week, and we look ahead to a huge clash away to Exeter Chiefs on Sunday. (0.30) Intro  (5.00) Review of Munster v Bayonne (23.25) Star of the Week (26.40) Exeter Chiefs Preview The first twenty minutes of this week's podcast is unlocked, but to listen to the full podcast, get on over to the Off The Ball app, or become a member at offtheball.

item.title: Rugby Daily | Munster ban jersey-tugger, Tucker defends Connacht attitude, Syd Millar RIP | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Monday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news aplenty from Munster, who have banned the fan who tugged at the jersey of a Bayonne player on Saturday. We hear from Tadhg Beirne too on that disappointing draw. James Ryan hails the immediate impact of Jacques Nienaber at Leinster following their win at La Rochelle. There's bad news for Connacht regarding Mack Hansen, but coach Colm Tucker hits back at questions of attitude problems within the province.

item.title: Rugby Daily | Harry's game for Leinster, O'Gara on French refs, Young Ireland prospects for Italian job | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you team news from Leinster, Munster and Ulster ahead of their opening fixtures in the Investec Champions Cup. Ronan O'Gara has his say after his latest one-game ban in France. A youthful Combined Academies squad is to face Italian opposition either side of Christmas. And Antoine Dupont hits back at critics of his Sevens switch. Transcript

item.title: Football Daily: Everton move out of bottom three, Spurs winless run continues, Alisson close to return from injury | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Sample of Football Daily for rugby fans! Welcome to Friday's Football Daily - Phil Egan runs you through all you need to know from world football. Subscribe to the OTB Football podcast feed to hear the best football analysis, interviews and stories from Off The Ball. Transcript

item.title: Football Daily: Villa move above City, Liverpool cut gap on Arsenal, Keegan steps down as Cobh boss | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Sample of Football Daily for rugby fans! Welcome to Thursday's Football Daily - Phil Egan runs you through all you need to know from world football. Subscribe to the OTB Football podcast feed to hear the best football analysis, interviews and stories from Off The Ball. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Bundee's back, Santi the spy, Lions to Dublin, Wallaby defects | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Thursday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you team news from Connacht ahead of their Investec Champions Cup meeting with Bordeaux, and we hear from Pete Wilkins regarding some insider knowledge of the Top 14 side. The British & Irish Lions will make history in 2025, with a first visit to Dublin. Plus, Australian rugby is rocked by a major defection to the NRL. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Baird talks to OTB, EPCR move to protect refs, Provinces' govt boosts | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Wednesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news of EPCR measures to protect referees from online abuse ahead of this season's Champions Cup and Challenge Cup. We hear from Leinster forward Ryan Baird and Connacht coach Mark Sexton with both provinces featuring in exclusive games this weekend on Off The Ball. Plus, three provinces benefit from a boost in government funding. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Nienaber speaks to OTB, Byrne a Six Nations doubt, Reilly surgery | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Tuesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you injury news from three provinces ahead of their opening fixtures in this season's Investec Champions Cup. New Leinster senior coach Jacques Nienaber speaks to OTB for the first time, but there's bad news on the injury front for Ross Byrne. The refereeing appointments for the Six Nations have been revealed. While Joe Schmidt is in the frame for an international vacancy.

item.title: The Red 78 Unlocked: Warriors defeated, Ahern shines, and Bayonne battle ahead in Thomond - Ep. 79 | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Ruairi O’Hagan is joined by Munster legends Alan Quinlan and Fiona Hayes to look back on the Reds’ win over Glasgow Warriors at a bitterly cold Musgrave Park. Certainly a lot to discuss with six tries, some excellent performances, but some serious worries about Munster’s maul defence. Fiona and Alan pick their Star of the Week, there’s a preview of the clash with Bayonne, and Quinny recalls in the infamous ‘Battle of Bayonne’ in 2007, with Ireland involved in a bruising World Cup warm up game against the French side

item.title: Rugby Daily: Kleyn blow for Munster | Connacht's Aki boost | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Monday's Rugby Daily, Will O'Callaghan has the injury news from the provinces at the start of the opening weekend of this season's Champions Cup. Jean Kleyn is out until January but Bundee Aki is in line to return for Connacht. Plus, New Zealand have secured the future of one of their stars until the end of the next World Cup. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Mack is back, Ireland's Six Nations nationwide tour, Farrell marked absent | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack has all the team news ahead of tomorrow's interpro in Galway. Mack is back for Connacht, while a much-changed Leinster will herald Cian Healy's return. The Ulster faithful will get a first look at Steven Kitshoff. Ireland are to tour the provinces again in next year's Women's Six Nations. Plus, Farrell misses latest Saracens outing. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | McCall says Farrell treatment 'shameful', Jager for Munster debut, Stade players' disgrace | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Thursday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings news of Oli Jager's impending Munster debut. Mark McCall lashes out at the "shameful" treatment of England captain Owen Farrell. Plus, the s**t is hitting the fan at Stade Francais where one player is in danger of the sack. Transcript

item.title: LUNCHTIME WRAP: Kelleher gets Liverpool nod, Jager set for Munster debut | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Thursday's Lunchtime Wrap on Off The Ball, Jurgen Klopp backs Coaimhín Kelleher to step up in the absence of Allison, Denise O'Sullivan on whether or not a move to the WSL would tempt her, Oli Jager set for his Munster debut and Tiger Woods returns to competitive golf. In association with the Department of Justice. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily: Farrell to take a break from England duty, Ireland 7s squads announced, O'Gara's disciplinary hearing | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Wednesday's Rugby Daily, we hear about Owen Farrell's decision to take a break from international rugby. The Ireland 7s squads for this weekend's action have been confirmed. La Rochelle head coach Ronan O'Gara is set for a disciplinary next week. And Exeter's Rob Baxter has a word of advice for football as they consider introducing sin bins. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Welcome back Mack, Nienaber's role at Leinster and who is Munster's next captain? | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Tuesday's Rugby Daily with Ann-Marie Donelan there's good news for Connacht fans as Mack Hansen may play this weekend, James Treacy assesses Jacques Nienaber's role at Leinster and speculation continues over Munster's next captain. Transcript

item.title: The Red 78 Unlocked: Positive performance at the Aviva, new contracts and O’Mahony stands down as skipper - Ep. 78 | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Ruairi O’Hagan is joined by Munster legends Alan Quinlan and Fiona Hayes to look back on the Reds’ defeat to Leinster and the positive aspects of the performance. Fiona and Alan pick their Star of the Week, there’s a preview of the clash with table toppers Glasgow in Cork, we talk about new deals for Munster stars and we discuss Peter O’Mahony standing down as captain. (0.30) Intro

item.title: Rugby Daily | Munster - Leinster assestment, Nienaber arrives in Dublin and Welsh blow for Six Nations | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Monday's Rugby Daily with Ann-Marie Donelan looks back on Saturday night's URC clash between Munster and Leinster, can Jacques Nienaber provide silverware for the Blues and the Welsh are dealt a blow ahead of the Six Nations. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily: Leinster and Munster name teams for URC derby, Steven Kitshoff on Ulster's prospects, Northampton's positive financial news | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's Rugby Daily, Cathal Mullaney brings you the team news from all four Irish provinces ahead of the weekend's URC action. Jeremy Loughman and Sean O'Brien look ahead to Leinster's clash with Munster on Saturday. Steven Kitshoff sets out his intent as he gets set to make his Ulster debut. And after a difficult year for the Premiership, Northampton Saints' report a better financial picture. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Wood on Munster captaincy, D'Arcy tackles SA doper's comeback, RWA nominees revealed | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Thursday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the latest on Peter O'Mahony's decision to step down as Munster captain + we hear from Keith Wood on who should replace the flanker. Gordon D'Arcy lashes out at the welcome back given to doper, Aphiwe Dyantyi. And the nominees are revealed for the Guinness Rugby Writers' Awards. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Farrell on Farrell, Ringrose talks up Prendergast, Kinghorn to France | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Wednesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the best of Eoin Sheahan's interviews from the launch of the Investec Champions Cup at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. We hear from Craig Casey and Garry Ringrose ahead of Saturday's clash of Leinster and Munster at the Aviva. Paul Boyle offers unique insight to the Pete Wilkins revolution at Connacht. Stuart McCloskey on what motivates him at Ulster. Blair Kinghorn is off to France.

item.title: Rugby Daily | Kitshoff debut, Schmidt to France? Earl news good - Curry news bad | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Tuesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack has news of Steven Kitshoff's imminent debut for Ulster. There's mixed news on the injury front among England's back row with the Six Nations looming on the horizon. And could Joe Schmidt revive his coaching career in France? Transcript

item.title: The Red 78 Unlocked: Stormers beaten, Leinster on the horizon and a debut for Oli Jager? - Ep. 77 | OTB Rugby
Rugby Daily | Doris on Munster challenge, France coaching shake-up, Ousted RA chair bites back | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Monday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the major fitness updates from the provinces ahead of a huge week of action in the URC. We hear from Caelan Doris on Leinster's date with Munster at the Aviva. The Celtic Challenge is to morph into an expanded format, and pretty soon too. The France coaching ticket is poised for major upheaval ahead of the Six Nations. More tragedy befalls South African rugby, as a fifth member of their 1995 World Cup-winning team dies.

item.title: Rugby Daily | Big guns back for Leinster and Munster, Meath star's Olympic hope, civil war in Australia | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you team news from three provinces ahead of this weekend's URC fixtures, with a host of Ireland stars returning for Munster, Leinster and Connacht. Vikki Wall's hopes of becoming an Olympian have become very, very real. Plus, civil war has erupted in Australian rugby. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | A shot of Jager Munster, Herring & Henderson return, Jaminet transfer | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Thursday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news of three new arrivals at Munster, including Irish-qualified tighthead, Oli Jager. There's team news ahead of Ulster's URC date with the Lions. Taine Basham's received a ban for his challenge on Ross Byrne. And Melvyn Jaminet is on the move in France. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Dupont to miss Six Nations, World Cup trophy survives break-in, World Rugby snap back at Smith try claims | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Wednesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you that incredible news that Antoine Dupont is to sacrifice the Six Nations in pursuit of an Olympic dream. World Rugby fire back at claims an Aaron Smith try during the World Cup final should have stood. The Webb Ellis trophy survives a break-in in South Africa, as one of its winners has his season ended by a knee injury. Transcript

item.title: The Red 78 Unlocked: Ulster victorious, Stormers in Limerick and a tribute to Andrew Conway - Ep. 76 | OTB Rugby
Rugby Daily | WRU apologises for 'toxic' culture, Van der Flier on World Cup heartache, France lock facing longer sentence | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Tuesday's Rugby Daily, we hear from Josh van der Flier as he prepares to make his Leinster return. The Ireland back row discusses his World Cup heartache, and how he's recovered. The WRU has apologised after an independent review found elements of the union harboured a racist, sexist, misogynistic and homophobic culture without being tackled. The first domino has fallen in Rugby Australia's centralisation plan. And France lock Bastien Chalureau is facing a longer sentence than first handed to him for an alleged racist attack.

item.title: Rugby Daily | Munster want Snyman compensation, Aki a Champions Cup doubt, the Eddie Jones Job Spot | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Monday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news of Munster wanting compensation for RG Snyman's latest injury, plus there's interest in the injury-prone lock's signature. Connacht reveal their travelling party for their URC games in South Africa, and it's notable for who isn't included. Plus, the latest edition of the Eddie Jones Job Spot. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Captain Sheehan, Jager to Munster? Wallabies star to swap codes | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the team news from Leinster and Connacht ahead of this weekend's away trips for both provinces. Oli Jager's destination now appears certain. And the Wallabies could be losing one of their few genuine stars to the NRL. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Conway retirement shock, Jager back to Ireland, Price is right for Edinburgh | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Thursday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the sad news of Andrew Conway's immediate retirement. Oli Jager looks set to return to Ireland having given his notice at the Crusaders. Ulster and Munster name their teams for their interpro derby, with plenty of Ireland internationals back in the fold. And Scotland scrum-half Ali Price makes a move in the national interest. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Springbok legend retires, Barnes addresses social media abuse, Mbonambi labels England "unprofessional" | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Wednesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news of a Springbok legend's retirement. Bongi Mbonambi has strong words for England following the racism row that almost cost him at World Cup final place. Wayne Barnes reveals the extent of the abuse he's received in the wake of the World Cup final. Plus, Fabien Galthié speaks for the first time since France's World Cup exit. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Rowntree on Snyman, Kleyn and Carbery, Jones on Japan links | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Tuesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news aplenty from Munster, where Graham Rowntree has provided injury updates on RG Snyman and Joey Carbery. We also get his assessment of Ulster. Plus, Eddie Jones rows back on his own claims that he'll be back in work "very shortly". Transcript

item.title: The Red 78 Unlocked: Young guns slay Dragons, build-up to Ulster, and Snyman injured again - Ep. 75 | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Ruairi O’Hagan is joined by Munster legends Alan Quinlan and Fiona Hayes to look back on an impressive win over the Dragons in Musgrave Park. Fiona and Alan pick their Star of the Week, there’s a preview of Friday’s clash with Ulster and plenty more. The first twenty minutes of this week's podcast is unlocked, but to listen to the full podcast, get on over to the Off The Ball app, or become a member at offtheball.

item.title: Rugby Daily | Snyman injury blow, Kleyn to France? Cane ban | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Monday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news of the latest injury to befall RG Snyman, while two of his international teammates appear destined for France in the summer. We hear from Sean O'Brien as Leinster's Ireland contingent return to the fold, and Pete Wilkins aims to address Connacht's away from having made the Sportsground a fortress. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | ROG on Lions, Carbery blow, Cane to Japan | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news of Ronan O'Gara's response to talk linking him with a Lions gig. There's bad news for Joey Carbery and Munster as a former Cork hurling star awaits the provincial debut. Jack Carty's back for Connacht, and Ulster make a host of changes for tomorrow's derby in Galway. Plus, Sam Cane's off to Japan as his former All Blacks coach lands a dig on New Zealand Rugby.

item.title: Rugby Daily | What will David Humphreys bring to IRFU? Eddie Jones on leaving Australia job and Wayne Barnes hangs up his boots | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Thursday's Rugby Daily Ann-Marie Donelan looks ahead to what David Humphreys might bring to the IRFU Performance Director role, Eddie Jones on his departure from Australian job and Wayne Barnes calls time on career. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Nucifora out Humphreys in, Wood on Lions, Leinster prop to France | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Wednesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news of the new big cheese at the IRFU. Keith Wood also offers an interesting Lions coaching ticket, and a Leinster player is off to France. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Farrell for Lions? Jones resigns, more Carbery injury woe | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Tuesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news of - and reaction to - Eddie Jones' resignation as Wallabies head coach. Andy Farrell's been recommended for the Lions job by the highest source possible. We've injury news from Munster, Ulster and Connacht with bad news for Joey Carbery. Plus an England stalwart calls time on their international career. Transcript

item.title: Connacht's strong start about to be tested by Ulster in massive interpro | PETE WILKINS | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Connacht head coach Pete Wilkins addressed the media after two good performances over the last two weeks set them up nicely ahead of their interpro with Ulster this weekend. Vodafone Ireland | #TeamOfUs Transcript

item.title: The Red 78 Unlocked: Great escape in Italy, Munster hope to slay Dragons, and a tribute to Keith Earls | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description A brand new season of The Red 78 kicks off with Alan Quinlan back in the hotseat, joined by newcomers Fiona Hayes and Ruairí O’Hagan to talk all things Munster Rugby every Tuesday - the first twenty minutes of this week's podcast is unlocked, but to listen to the full podcast, get on over to the Off The Ball app, or become a member at offtheball.com/join. (0.00) Intro

item.title: Rugby Daily | Bundee's new deal, Eddie Jones "pissed off", URC team news | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news of - and reaction to - Bundee Aki's contract extension. There's team news galore ahead of another packed weekend of URC action. Eddie Jones is "pissed off" with the current situation in Australian Rugby. And Felipe Contepomi reveals who he believes are the best team in the world.... still. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Mbonambi cleared, RWC final teams named, Jones out? | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description In Thursday's bumper Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the team news for Saturday's World Cup final. We hear from Jacques Nienaber, Siya Kolisi, Sam Cane and Ian Foster. The RFU come out swinging against the decision to clear Bongi Mbonambi. Ireland name their team to play Spain in the WXV. Plus, those Eddie Jones rumours have cropped up yet again Down Under. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Mbonambi latest, England defend Curry, Boks hail Felix Jones | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Wednesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the latest on the Bongi Mbonambi case. We hear from Willie Le Roux on his England celebrations and a tribute to the departing Felix Jones. England head coach Steve Borthwick and captain Owen Farrell rally around Tom Curry as the flanker is picked for tomorrow's World Cup bronze medal match. Leigh Halfpenny announces his international retirement. And Munster add some road-tested quality to their academy.

item.title: ANDREW GOODMAN: Nations Championship is 'a work in progress' | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Leinster backs coach Andrew Goodman spoke to the media ahead of their clash with The Sharks in the URC this weekend, he also discussed the changes to the rugby calendar. Off The Ball Rugby with Vodafone Ireland | #TeamOfUs Transcript

item.title: JORDAN LARMOUR: Flipping the page after missing out. on World Cup selection | Leinster v Sharks | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Leinster's Jordan Larmour spoke to the media about last weekend's loss to Glasgow in the URC and ahead of hosting The Sharks on Saturday afternoon. Rugby on Off The Ball with Vodafone Ireland | #TeamOfUs Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Expanded World Cup, Nations Championship, Healy injury blow | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Tuesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack breaks down the announced changes to the World Cup structure, its draw time and the new international calendar. Bongi Mbonambi's trouble may not be stemming from the incident we all presumed. And we hear from Leinster coach Andrew Goodman following news of a further injury blow to Cian Healy. Transcript

item.title: The F1 Pod - BONUS EPISODE: Conor Moore | Niki Lauda memories | puking in the helmet | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description It's a bonus episode of The Formula 1 pod this week - as we bring you some of the best bits from the season so far! Host Shane Hannon was joined by Conor Moore aka Conor Sketches to bring us some of his best F1 impersonations, five-time F1 Grand Prix winner John Watson on his relationship with his former teammate Niki Lauda, and Bernie Collins, the former Head of Race Strategy with Aston Martin F1, brings us her incredible insight.

item.title: Rugby Daily | Mbonambi allegation, Barnes gets final, Carty & Hansen updates | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Monday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news of the refereeing appointments for the last two matches at the World Cup. World Rugby are looking into the alleged discriminatory language used by Bongi Mbonambi in Saturday's semi-final win over England. Plus, we hear from Pete Wilkins and Leo Cullen after the opening weekend of the URC. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Reinach death threats, Addison & Conway make long awaited returns | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news ahead of tonight's Rugby World Cup semi-finals. We hear from Michael Cheika and Steve Hansen ahead of the showdown in Saint-Denis. The Springboks have had to respond to death threats sent to Cobus Reinach ahead of their semi-final with England. And a hale and hearty welcome back from injury to both Will Addison and Andrew Conway this weekend. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Smith out of semi, Lienert-Brown on Ireland, WXV team revealed | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Thursday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you team news for Saturday's World Cup semi-final clash of England and the Springboks. We hear from Owen Farrell, Steve Borthwick, Jacques Nienaber and Siya Kolisi. The All Blacks can't stop name-checking Ireland, plus ex-Leinster man Felipe Contepomi plots another shock Pumas win. And the Ireland team to play Colombia in the WXV is in, and shows three changes. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily: Rassie Erasmus and Handre Pollard on England, O'Driscoll pays tribute to Sexton | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Wednesday's Rugby Daily, we hear from Rassie Erasmus and Handre Pollard ahead of this weekend's Rugby World Cup semi-final against England. There's also insight from the English camp with Ollie Chessum. One Irish legend pays tribute to another, as Brian O'Driscoll has his say on Johnny Sexton's career. And Will Greenwood identifies his key moment from New Zealand's win over Ireland last weekend. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Earls retires, Eddie's not for moving, Raiwalui quits | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Tuesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack delivers news of Keith Earls' immediate retirement. We hear from Eddie Jones on his plans to stay in the Wallabies job. But Fiji are yet again on the hunt for a new head coach. All that, plus a change in URC format and team news from Connacht and Ulster ahead of their opening weekend fixtures. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Conan, Rassie, Coles and more on quarter-finals, Munster & Connacht updates | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Monday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you all the reaction worth hearing from Saturday's pulsating World Cup quarter-finals. We hear from Jack Conan, Iain Henderson, Jason Ryan, Dane Coles and Rassie Erasmus. Plus, the URC is back this weekend (we know!) and we've updates from Munster and Connacht, and hear from the latter's head coach Pete Wilkins. Transcript

item.title: Johnny Sexton & Andy Farrell Press Conference | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Jonathan Sexton & Andy Farrell spoke to the press after Ireland's 24-28 loss to the All Blacks. Rugby on OTB with Vodafone Ireland | #TeamOfUs Transcript

item.title: NEW ZEALAND: 'Our main focus is to earn another week' | New Zealand captains run ahead of Ireland quarter final | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description New Zealand head coach Ian Foster, as well as outside backs Will Jordan and Leicester Fainga'anuku addressed the media a day before the quarter final with Ireland. Vodafone Ireland | #TeamOfUs Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Ryan and Hansen injury updates, Dupont returns, Smith FB experiment continues | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you all the key updates from Ireland's captain's run ahead of their World Cup quarter-final showdown with the All Blacks. We hear from Caelan Doris, Dan Sheehan and Mike Catt. Antoine Dupont is back for France, but Handre Pollard misses out on a starting berth for the Springboks. And Steve Borthwick is determined to make Marcus Smith at full-back a thing. Transcript

item.title: Caelan Doris, Dan Sheehan & Mike Catt | Ireland Captain's Run | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Caelan Doris, Dan Sheehan & Mike Catt spoke to the media following Ireland's Captain's Run before their quarterfinal clash vs. New Zealand on Saturday. Rugby on Off the Ball with Vodafone Ireland. Transcript

item.title: THE ALL BLACKS ANNOUNCE THEIR TEAM FOR IRELAND: Ian Foster, and New Zealand players | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description After New Zealand head coach Ian Foster named a strong team to face Ireland in the World Cup Quarter Final, he and several players including his captain Sam Cane addressed the media in the build up to the crucial encounter. Flyhalf Richie Mo'unga and loose forward Ardie Savea look at the threats Ireland pose, while second rower Scott Barrett and hooker Codie Taylor expressed their excitement for Saturday night lights in Paris.

item.title: Rugby Daily | All Blacks curfew breach, Gatland on draw moaners, Jones to Japan | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Thursday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings news of the All Blacks team to play Ireland in Saturday's World Cup quarter-final, and that news includes a surprise omission. We hear from Warren Gatland ahead of Wales' date with Argentina, and he has a word for those who've moaned about a lopsided draw. And reports re-emerge about Eddie Jones' potential return to Japan. Transcript

item.title: Sonny Bill Williams - Live from Vicar St. | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Sonny Bill Williams was our special guest at Vicar St. for the Off The Ball Rugby World Cup Roadshow on Wednesday as we gear up for Ireland's clash with New Zealand this weekend. item.title: Rugby Daily | Henshaw hope, AB's Lomax concern, Willis departs | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the very latest ahead of Ireland's Pool B showdown with Scotland. We hear from Andy Farrell, John Fogarty, James Lowe and Tadhg Beirne for the Irish perspective, plus Scotland duo Huw Jones and Grant Gilchrist give their side of events. There's renewed optimism about Robbie Henshaw's participation in France, but the All Blacks are sweating on Tyrell Lomax's availability for the knockout stages.

item.description: Podcast Description Ireland assistant coach John Fogarty, and players James Lowe & Tadhg Beirne addressed the media on the eve of their clash with Scotland in the final weekend of pool matches at the World Cup. Vodafone Ireland | #TeamOfUs Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Henshaw's World Cup doubt, SA in WADA row, Farrell to set record | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Thursday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the confirmed team news for Saturday's showdown in St. Denis. We hear from Ireland head coach Andy Farrell, Iain Henderson and Gregor Townsend on the big game. However, the news is far from positive regarding Robbie Henshaw. South Africa could be forced to compete under a neutral flag in the knockout phase, if their government don't sort a row with WADA.

item.title: Rugby Daily | Ireland injury concern, NZ prop admits Uruguay are 'easy', Dupont latest | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Wednesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack has the latest news from Tours where an injury concern over one of the Ireland players has been let slip. We hear from Bundee Aki and Paul O'Connell on Saturday's 'knockout' showdown with Scotland. There's the latest on Antoine Dupont's situation with France ahead of their last pool outing. Plus, a New Zealand prop admits their pool game with Uruguay should be "

item.title: Rugby Daily | James Ryan boost, Finn Russell's impact and Sam Cane's first WC start | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Tuesday's Rugby Daily Ann-Marie Donelan brings you welcome James Ryan injury news, the view from Scotland ahead of Irish Paris showdown and New Zealand captain Sam Cane is set for his first start of the tournament. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Rassie's Ireland mind game, Eddie's safe, final call on Dupont | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Monday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news of another enforced alteration to the Springboks' World Cup squad. We also hear from their director of rugby Rassie Erasmus, as he attempts to play mind games with Ireland. Eddie Jones' position as Wallabies head coach appears to be safe, despite their disastrous World Cup. We've the latest on Antoine Dupont following his return to training with France. And Wales name their team for Georgia, with revenge on their minds.

item.title: Rugby Daily | Henshaw back to work, Scotland's butcher speaks, Brennan clan back to Munster | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the latest from the Ireland camp as they get back to work in Tours. We hear from Robbie Henshaw, and there's an update on Cian Healy's fitness. Javan Sebastian - Scotland's ex-butcher - talks ahead of their Pool B fixture with Romania. And a host of Ireland internationals will start for Munster against the Barbarians tomorrow, with a very familiar surname on the visitors' bench.

item.title: Rugby Daily: Vikki Wall eyes up Olympics, South Africa analyse Irish defeat, more financial trouble in the English club game | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Thursday's Rugby Daily with Ann-Marie Donelan Vikki Wall eyes up Olympics with Irish Sevens, South Africa say loss to Ireland not all down to kicking and more disappointing news from England domestic game as financial crisis deepens.  Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily: France confident on Dupont return | Wallabies on the slide | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Wednesday's Rugby Daily with Ann-Marie Donelan, France are set to welcome back Dupont, there's more reaction to Ireland-South Africa and Australia slide down world rankings. Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | BOD on Ireland v South Africa, New beginnings for Irish Women's side | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Tuesday's Rugby Daily, Ann-Marie Donelan brings you the latest rugby news including BOD's view of Ireland/South Africa, new beginnings for the Irish Women's side.  Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | New Rowntree deal, Scotland and NZ on Ireland, Handre Pollard is not Superman | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Monday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you reaction to Ireland's bruising win over the Springboks on Saturday. We hear from scrum coach John Fogarty, plus Gregor Townsend and Scott McLeod give their unique perspectives on the coverage since. There's good news for Munster fans regarding head coach Graham Rowntree. Eddie Jones reacts angrily to stories linking him with a Japan return. And Rassie Erasmus gives his take on Handre Pollard's return to the Springbok team.

item.title: IRELAND 13 - 8 SOUTH AFRICA | Reaction from: Sexton, Kolisi, Farrell, Nienaber & More! | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Adrian Barry was on hand to get interviews from the likes of Tadhbg Beirne, Finley Bealham and Ryan Baird. He was also able to record Ireland's and South Africa's tabletop press conferences. Rugby on OTB with thanks to Vodafone Ireland | #TeamOfUs Transcript

item.title: Rugby Daily | Dupont injury latest, Stick issues Ireland challenge, Jones on future | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's bumper Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the latest on Antoine Dupont's injury with the France captain's World Cup participation hanging by a thread. We hear from Paul O'Connell, Mzwandile Stick, Damien de Allende and Brian O'Driscoll ahead of tomorrow's showdown at the Stade de France. And Eddie Jones gives the latest on his future as Australia head coach, with sympathy coming from a surprising source.

item.title: ‘This is everything we’ve been working towards’ | Ireland captain’s run ahead of South Africa | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Ireland's Mack Hansen, Josh van der Flier and Paul O'Connell addressed the media on the eve of the biggest game in Pool B of the Rugby World Cup, against South Africa. Vodafone Ireland | #TeamOfUs Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description On Thursday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the Ireland team news for Saturday's World Cup showdown with the Springboks. We hear from Andy Farrell, Garry Ringrose and Siya Kolisi on the big game in Saint-Denis. Matt Williams goes deep on his dislike of the 7-1 bench split. Marcus Smith's new role for England is confirmed. And one Wallaby is pin-pointed for their downfall so far at the World Cup.

item.title: Reaction to South Africa's 7-1 split, Irish lineup to face the Boks | Andy Farrell & Johnny Sexton | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description Irish boss Andy Farrell & captain Johnny Sexton speak ahead of the South Africa clash on Saturday as the Ireland lineup is announced. Rugby with Vodafone Ireland | #TeamOfUs Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description On Wednesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the latest from the Ireland camp including news on Jack Conan and Dan Sheehan's availability for Saturday's Springboks showdown. We hear from Simon Easterby and Jacques Nienaber on that controversial 7-1 split on the Boks' bench. England have found a new use for Marcus Smith, while Australia have another injury headache. And Ian Madigan has announced his retirement from rugby. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description On Tuesday's Rugby Daily, Cathal Mullaney brings you the injury news from the Ireland camp in Tours. item.description: Podcast Description On Monday's Rugby Daily, Cathal Mullaney brings you the details as Rassie Erasmus rules out a potential future role with the IRFU. There's also injury news from the South African camp ahead of their clash with Ireland next weekend. Eddie Jones is already looking ahead to Australia's meeting with Wales after their loss to Fiji. And England head coach Steve Borthwick wants his side to continue their upward trajectory after a 34-12 win over Japan.

item.title: Rugby Daily | Conan Boks hope, choral anthem update, Keegan insight | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Wendesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the latest on Jack Conan's injury status ahead of the Tonga game. We hear from Keith Earls, Craig Casey, Mick Kearney and performance coach Gary Keegan. We hear too from the World Cup organisers on the stadium entry issues, the choral anthems and tournament refereeing. Ian Foster speaks after naming his All Blacks side to face Namibia. And four World Cup debutants are named in the Wales team to play Portugal.

item.title: Rugby Daily | Conan injury latest, Curry ban, Rassie's return to Ireland? | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Tuesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the latest injury news from the Ireland camp ahead of Saturday's World Cup clash with Tonga. Tom Curry learns of his ban following his red card in England's win over Argentina. A Springboks legend has backed Rassie Erasmus for a return to Ireland, while Felix Jones explains the traffic light system. And France rest their big guns for Thursday's Pool A game with Uruguay.

item.title: Rugby Daily | Etzebeth hope, Kriel escape, anthem changes on horizon | OTB Rugby
item.description: Podcast Description On Monday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the latest on Springbok hopes to have Eben Etzebeth and Jesse Kriel in the clear to play Ireland on Saturday-week. We hear from Jacques Nienaber too on the Boks' traffic light system. There's the latest on plans to play Jonathan Sexton against Tonga. Bad news for France on hooker Julien Marchand. Plus, a change is a-coming on the anthem front at the World Cup.

item.description: Podcast Description Ireland captain Johnny Sexton & head coach Andy Farrell review their dominant 82-8 win over Romania in their Rugby World Cup opener. Vodafone Ireland | #TeamOfUs Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the latest from Ireland's captain's run in Bordeaux. We hear from Mike Catt on the non-selection of Mack Hansen for tomorrow. James Ryan discusses the oppressive heat in Bordeaux, and his excitement at starting alongside one Leinster teammate in particular. We hear from Gregor Townsend as he names his team to play the Springboks in Marseille on Sunday. Plus, we learn of the influence of a certain Joe Schmidt on the All Blacks camp ahead of tonight's opening fixture at the Stade de France.

item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you news of an historic announcement from Ulster. The teams are in for the Women's Interprovincial final at Musgrave Park. Eddie Jones blames the RFU for the lack of England breakout stars. And there's more bad news on the injury front for France ahead of next week's big kick-off at the World Cup. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description On Wednesday's Rugby Daily, Cathal Mullaney brings you the details of Scott Bemand's Ireland women's squad for the WXV tournament in Dubai. Dan Sheehan speaks of his relief at shaking off injury to travel to the World Cup. Joey Carbery says he'll be ready if he's called upon by Andy Farrell during the tournament. And Colin Slade has his say on Steve Hansen's decision to help out Australia in recent weeks.

item.description: Podcast Description On Monday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the latest from the Ireland camp. We hear from Andy Farrell and Jonathan Sexton as the final squad of 33 is revealed. We hear too from All Blacks head coach Ian Foster, who can count on Scott Barrett at the World Cup. Steve Borthwick tries to explain away England's shock defeat to Fiji, as they fall to a record low in the World Rugby rankings.

item.title: IRELAND'S RUGBY WORLD CUP SQUAD NAMED | Cian Healy Injury blow, Sexton on his ban | OTB Rugby

item.description: Podcast Description On Friday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the latest from the Ireland camp ahead of tomorrow's final World Cup warm-up with Samoa in Bayonne. We hear from captain Iain Henderson and head coach Andy Farrell. There's cruel news for Connacht and their star summer signing Santiago Cordero. There's mixed news on the appeal front for two of Ireland's World Cup pool opponents. Plus we hear from Maeve Óg O'Leary and Eimear Corri ahead of a pivotal weekend in the Women's Interpro series.

item.description: Podcast Description On Wednesday's Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you the details behind Owen Farrell and Billy Vunipola's suspensions. item.description: Podcast Description On Monday’s Rugby Daily, Richie McCormack brings you reaction to Ireland’s win over England at the Aviva. We hear from Keith Earls and Steve Borthwick. item.title: THE INTERNATIONAL RUGBY EXPERIENCE IN LIMERICK | Johnny Sexton, Rory Best, Bryan Habana, Matt Dawson, Paul O'Connell & AP McCoy | OTB Rugby

Inspired by World Rugby’s values of Passion, Discipline, Integrity, Solidarity and Respect, visitors will hear the stories, feel the passion and test their own skills as they move through six, awe-inspiring stages inside the state-of-the-art building.

There’s the team news for Leinster v Munster, and we hear from both Leo Cullen and Alan Quinlan. Bulls chief Jake White on why he “feels sorry” for Johan Goosen. Plus news of a former England captain’s retirement. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Richie McCormack brings you team news for tomorrow night’s meeting of Connacht and the Scarlets - plus David Hawkshaw on his move out west. Fiona Hayes and Ruaidhrí O’Connor set the table for Saturday’s clash of Leinster and Munster at the Aviva. item.description: Podcast Description On today’s Rugby Daily, news of the Ireland squad - and it’s ‘A’ annex - for the autumn internationals. item.description: Podcast Description On today’s Rugby Daily, we hear from Munster forwards coach Andy Kyriacou ahead of their trip to Leinster, with the injury news not very promising. Plus, Gordon D’Arcy on what he sees as Ulster’s shortcomings this season ahead of their date with the Sharks.
